captions.text: ♪ (music) ♪

La Pinilla looks
like a great mountain resort.

There are many trails, you know,
the pine trees smell good
and it's really nice.

I know Red Bull put
lots of work into this project,

and now it looks even better,
like a real bike park.
♪ (music builds) ♪
Red Bull Holy Bike is a special event

because you've got one bike
and you need to do:

downhill trail, Enduro style,
a little bit of climbing,

and then at the end
we've got a massive Downhill.

A new event that only
a few people have done.

We are looking forward to see
if the choices we've made work out
in terms of both bikes and tires.
♪ (music) ♪
Well, it has really been a fun weekend.

The coolest thing of the competition
for me has been the final Avalanche.

It has been such
an unforgettable experience
I just can't wait to come back next year.
This is probably the best race in Spain
when it comes to atmosphere, people...

I just think it's an awesome race,
a race that deserves saying:
Red Bull Holy Bike rocks!

title: Downhill enduro bike race in Spain - Red Bull Holy Bike 2014

comments.text:
downhill enduro, wtf even is that? the whole point of downhill is pretty 
much minimal pedalling, and the whole point of Enduro is to wear a fanny 
pack with 650b wheels...﻿
comments.author: Serge Gnabry

comments.text:
+Serge Gnabry Well as it is, Enduro is only timed on the downhills, not the 
climbs, so it kind of is downhill racing. On the other hand I think UCI 
Downhill needs to step their shit up, too slow, too much pedaling and too 
many smooth sections. Enduro bikes can do 90% of what DH bikes do, just not 
the huge jumps that could brake frames.
comments.author: TheOfficialKC

comments.text:
Sorry if it came across that I was saying the disciplines arent hard,  they 
are, I get that.  But surely they are completely different, , right down to 
the way the race days are, I just cant see how you can have  a downhill 
enduro race....
comments.author: Serge Gnabry

comments.text:
Haha really minimal pedalling? Have you raced in Fort William? that track 
demands more pedalling than a 4x track. And also Enduro you have to climb 
big as fuck slopes while still having some energy left on the technical 
downhill sections so both disciplines are pretty hard.
